alert.note: Alert for Braxton; Calhoun; Gilmer; Northwest Webster; Roane; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster; Wirt (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 3:29AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Calhoun, southwestern Randolph, Gilmer, Braxton, southeastern Wirt, north central Roane and northern Webster Counties through 400 AM EDT... At 328 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong, heavy thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles west of Grantsville to near Addison and Webster Springs. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Glenville, Sutton, Grantsville, Webster Springs, Gassaway, Addison (Webster Springs), Arnoldsburg, Holly River State Park, Cedar Creek State Park, Mingo, Burnsville, Flatwoods, Sand Fork, Shock, Millstone, Rosedale, Mount Zion, Pickens, Cleveland and Waneta. This includes Interstate 79 between mile markers 59 and 82. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
